items.text: When the app needs to use any of the protected features of the device (sending network requests, accessing the camera, sending an SMS, etc) it must obtain the appropriate permission from the user to do so.
items.href: Understanding App Permissions | CodePath Android Cliffnotes

items.text: Before Marshmallow, permissions were handled at install-time and specified in the AndroidManifest.xml within the project.
items.href: Understanding App Permissions | CodePath Android Cliffnotes

items.text: After Marshmallow, permissions must now be requested at runtime before being used.
items.href: Understanding App Permissions | CodePath Android Cliffnotes

items.text: These are permissions that are requested while the app is running (instead of before the app is installed).
items.href: Understanding App Permissions | CodePath Android Cliffnotes

items.text: These permission can then be allowed or denied by the user.
items.href: Understanding App Permissions | CodePath Android Cliffnotes
